paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the hERG-T618I variant in the KCNH2 gene, focusing on its functional effects and response to amiodarone treatment.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The hERG-T618 gain-of-function mutation results in an increased density of the I_Kr current and the short QT syndrome.
The hERG-T618 gain-of-function mutation results in an increased density of the I_Kr current and the short QT syndrome.

The hERG-T618 gain-of-function mutation results in an increased density of the I_Kr current and the short QT syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The hERG-T618I variant showed increased current density and altered drug sensitivity compared to wild-type.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the differential response to amiodarone in hERG-T618I carriers.
key_quotes: The hERG-T618 gain-of-function mutation results in an increased density of the I_Kr current and the short QT syndrome.
Ami effectively reduced the current in the phase 2 plateau (P < 0.05), but the phase 3 current did not exhibit the characteristics of a WT current.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
